is in londonurging his claims to a handsome retiring pension. thecoast guard of ireland has now been put upon the samefooting as the english and scotch. captain houstonstewart, c. 8., the comptroller-general, is now at thehead of the entire coast guard establishment of theunited kingdom, and the service in ireland will hence-forth be carried on under the appointment of a com-mander, who will act under the orders of the chiefcomptroller in london. a great saving will be made bythis arrangement, and the force will be rendered moreefficient.
